thread.title: Premier League title odds: Bookies slash price on Spurs to win title but Blues still odds-on favourites
thread.title_full: Premier League title odds: Bookies slash price on Spurs to win title but Blues still odds-on favourites

author: jgordon
title: Premier League title odds: Bookies slash price on Spurs to win title but Blues still odds-on favourites
text:
SPURS' ODDS TUMBLE Premier League title odds: Bookies slash price on Spurs to win title but Blues still odds-on favourites 
Dele Alli's double opens the door for several clubs as they try and reel in Antonio Conte's leaders By JAMIE GORDON Comments TOTTENHAM’S win over Chelsea has blown the Premier League title race wide open. 
After Dele Alli’s double wrapped up a huge derby win for Spurs , the Blues hold a five-point lead over second-place Liverpool . Getty Images 3 Dele Alli has scored two successive braces 
Spurs leapfrog the Gunners into third to see their title odds tumble to 14-1 from 20-1 with Sun Bets . 
Chelsea remain odds-on favourites – moving from 4-7 to 8-11 after seeing their 13-game win streak broken. 
Liverpool are second in the bookies’ reckonings, with Manchester City and Arsenal following. Manchester United complete the top six behind Spurs. Reuters Mauricio Pochettino has turned Spurs into genuine contenders News Group Newspapers Ltd Antonio Conte saw his side’s 13-match winning run come to an abrupt end Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea : Dele brace takes Tottenham up to third in the league Premier League Outright Premier League table: Spurs end Chelsea's 13 game winning streak WHITE HART SLAIN Dele Alli headed double ends Chelsea's 13-match win streak and record bid to send Spurs third in the table PLAYER RATINGS Dele Alli was in stunning form for Tottenham, but David Luiz had a poor game in Chelsea's defence FIVE THINGS WE LEARNT Spurs have a brilliant record when Dele Alli scores, defensive errors cost Chelsea, and Poch is one of the world's best managers HOW HAZ HE MISSED? Eden Hazard with miss of the season contender as Chelsea try to get level with Spurs Top-four Finish
